title.narrative: PSE OP 1 - EVIDENCE GENERATION

description.narrative: The socio-economic situation and its impact on the situation of mothers and children, as well as the recommendations from programme evaluation, are analyzed to better influence social policies and budgeting, and strengthen evidence-based programming., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Greater national commitment, accountability and capacity to legislate, plan and budget for inclusive social policies, and progressively integrate social protection measures into relevant programme areas.

title.narrative: The socio-economic situation and its impact on the situation of mothers and children, as well as the recommendations fromprogramme evaluation, are analyzed to better influence social policies and budgeting, and strengthen evidence-based programming.

description.narrative: In 2020,;results;have been achieved, in collaboration with partners,;to increase the understanding of the situation of children and women in Madagascar;in spite of and including the;COVID-19 pandemic. These include;the dissemination of the 2018 MICS-6;results;and the;MODA. A rapid socio-economic survey;has;been carried out to understand the impact of COVID-19;on children.;A real-time assessment of the COVID-19 response;has been initiated, jointly with other countries in the region.;In collaboration with the;Presidency, the National Assembly and the;Ministry of Economy and Finance, UNICEF;accompanied the preparation of the;National;Evaluation;Policy;and the Voluntary National Review (VNR);planned for 2021.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2021
